page.title: 03Local Crafts
page.content: {Marbling}is flicking paint on to a tank of water and combing or running a metal stick up and down through the paint and then laying a piece of paper on top to transfer the design on to it.{Solveig Stone}started marbling because her husband{Humphrey}designs books and she became interested in the end papers of the books which were often marbled, and she wanted to know how to do it. Lots of things are marbled from address books, note pads, lamp shades to gift wrapping paper. She has done this craft for thirteen years. {Johnny Goodall}was born in 1908 and trained to be an{artist.}He uses water and poster paints. There is also a{pottery}in the area that produces Tisbury pottery.
